column4: Where do I need to place a DLL I created to be able to use it with Ajunta?
Where do I need to place a DLL I created to be able to use it with Ajunta?
Where do I need to place a DLL I created to be able to use it with Ajunta?
We don't know, stop repeating yourself.
I do not know where you would put a DLL on a Linux machine to run an application I've never heard of. I would try to find the application package, the home page, installation documentation.
Under Ubuntu you normally don't.
You are obviously working from some instructions. Where are those?
Uhm. I'm not sure I follow. I do not know of a way to make a DLL from an interpreted language. DLL's are not normally used in Linux.
Ok, so it generates DLL's?
Yes, Sir.
Or does it generate .so's?
Ahhh...good point. It generates dlls for WIndows, and .so's for Linux.
And I'm guessing that you're in #ubuntu because you're running Linux :)
Indeed, Sir.
sudo cp
Thank you. Also, do you know how to create an install.sh batch file?
I see linux programs use them all the time.
Well, you create a text file with commands in it, then you make it executable with chmod +x
Really, that simple?
Yup. Many examples exist in /etc/init.d/
thank you.
